intro: Borreria aralioides, commonly known as the Mexican sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Borreria aralioides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
